Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2018 06:30PM Elena12 wrote: I want to thank everyone that gave me information and reassurance. I had the core needle biopsy two days ago and it was not at all painful (just like everyone said). The doctor just called and gave me the results....a fibroid, fatty, benign tumor. I am super relieved. I was told that if I wanted to be super, super careful, I could have a followup ultrasound in six months but that the radiologist wasn't even recommending that. Thanks again for everthing.
Posts.Title: Afraid of core needle biopsy Elena12 Georgia1

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2017 05:51PM Elena12 wrote: I just had an ultrasound and the radiologist said that the 9 cc lump was probably an interductal papilloma. I am having a core needle biopsy done next week and am very nervous that they will find something else. I know all the statistics but am still nervous, not sleepy, agitated,etc. I have questions about it even if (hopefully) it is an interductal papilloma. Do they always surgically remove the papilloma? If so, how long does it usually take between the biopsy diagnosis and surgery? Is it just a lumpectomy or more? I realize a lot of the answers depend on just what they find and what my particular doctor recommends. However at this point, I am just looking for some answers that might calm me down. I do much better when I know what I am up against. THANKS>
Posts.Title: Papilloma found, need surgery, many questions! rhonva Elena12
